content: arms make 2 arms are made using an i-cord use your preferred method a great tutorial can be seen here https //blog tincanknits com/2019/01/26/how-to-knit-an-i-cord/ it is suggested to use jewelry wire or floral wire to make him pose-able knit both arms first then work the wire through the body of the fish leaving ample length on either side for each arm wait to weave in your ends until after you are done so you can use the tails to attach the arms and secure the wire leave yourself 6 inches of tail when you cast on and at least 4 inches for the hands when you cast off co 3 stitches do not turn so you can work an i-cord knit 15 rounds of i-cord on round 15 do not slide your work turn your work to work next row of hands flat 1 p1 pfb p 2 kfb k2 kfb 3 p2tog break yarn and pull through this stitch - one finger made 4 join yarn to the 4 remaining stitches p2tog break yarn and pull through this stitch - second finger made 5 join yarn to the 2 remaining stitches p2tog break yarn and pull through this stitch - second finger made attaching the arms and finishing hands knit both arms first then work the wire through the body of the fish leaving ample length on either side for each arm the wire will go through the stuffed body poking out either side for each arm white portion is inside of fish in diagram below carefully work your wire through the middle of the i-cord arm cut the wire leaving a little extra overhanging so you can bend it back to form an oval loop inside the palm use the ends from the fingers to add structure to the hand by weaving through fingers and looping it around the oval formed by the wire wrapping it hides the wire and secures the end so it doesn t slide this makes him more posable but you can also just leave it straight and just work it around in that fashion if you want it less fiddly the wire may be more prone to slide if done that way use the cast on tail to attach the arm to the body and hide the wire repeat for the second arm legs make 2 like arms we will use an i-cord co 3 stitches do not turn so you can work an i-cord leave a 6 in tail so you can attach to body later knit 19 rounds of i-cord for rounds 20 and 21 ankle bend still slide your work to continue to work in an i-cord do not change what you are doing or knit flat round 20 k1 k2tog round 21 kfb k knit 3 more rounds of i-cord bind off leaving a 6 in tail to use to secure the wire attaching the legs and finishing feet knit both legs first then work the wire through the
